channel.title: The best browser?
channel.description:
Let the mass debate commence!
I prefer Firefox over Chrome, as I don't like Chromes interface.

item.title: The best browser?
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Used to use Opera, a fine browser. But I moved to Chrome when it came out, I can say it’s come leaps and bounds, and has my fave features from Opera in it now.

atm I use Chrome with AdBlock+ and mouse gestures.
.

Read full topic

item.title: The best browser?
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Jaycee:

I’ve got it to a point where IE8 is fine 99% of the time without work arounds, IE7 around 90% and IE6 always has issues but I know how to fix most of them by now without even needing to check.

So it’s annoying, but not the end of the world. But as I say, I only do the xhtml/css. Anything else is someone elses job

ive had trouble with things as simple as flash banners, where the text within the swf was a lot bigger than what it should’ve been when opening the page through IE.

Read full topic

item.title: The best browser?

item.description:
acade365:

All I know is that I’m always having to do ‘workarounds’ to get my sites working on IE.

I’ve got it to a point where IE8 is fine 99% of the time without work arounds, IE7 around 90% and IE6 always has issues but I know how to fix most of them by now without even needing to check.

So it’s annoying, but not the end of the world. But as I say, I only do the xhtml/css. Anything else is someone elses job

item.title: The best browser?
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Jaycee:

Never seen that before, interesting test though. Doesn’t really effect me as I don’t write my own js, and minimal need for the other areas of the test - DOM and CSS3 right? We have a programmer for all that fun stuff

From my experience IE8 renders web page layouts as accurately as Safari (with the odd glitch but nothing I can’t fix) and is secure enough that I don’t feel the need to educate anyone I find using it, which is a step up from 6 and 7 IMHO.

All I know is that I’m always having to do ‘workarounds’ to get my sites working on IE.

Read full topic

acade365:

Being a web designer myself, I hate IE8. And it’s not a matter of preference, this is IE8’s result on acid3:

https://i42.tinypic.com/20iwe8w.png

Never seen that before, interesting test though. Doesn’t really effect me as I don’t write my own js, and minimal need for the other areas of the test - DOM and CSS3 right? We have a programmer for all that fun stuff

From my experience IE8 renders web page layouts as accurately as Safari (with the odd glitch but nothing I can’t fix) and is secure enough that I don’t feel the need to educate anyone I find using it, which is a step up from 6 and 7 IMHO.

item.title: The best browser?
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
Elpants:

Opera was also the first browser to pass the Acid3 test with 100/100.

I don’t like how I get 94 points in Firefox and 100 in Chrome.

But at least Steam went with the better browser development kit for the beta UI, which means we get proper javascript in the overlay for once.

item.title: The best browser?
item.dc:creator: Jaycee
item.description:
As a web developer, Firefox wins because of all the useful plugins.

However if I was a regular user, I’d probably go Chrome for speed.

I used to use Opera, but some major shopping baskets (including Paypal) didn’t support it and wouldn’t let you use them. However, it did have many useful features that Firefox and many others didn’t/don’t as standard. These days I’m sure it’s fine for compatability but I have no reason to change back.

IE8 is fine, nothing special but not bad. IE7 sucks balls, and the less said about 6 the better. I’m sure may of you will think saying IE8 is ok is some kind of blasphemy, but really it’s a good browser. Trust me, I’m a web designer.

Also, I have to leave it there as my dinner’s in the oven… :o

Read full topic

item.title: The best browser?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I prefer firefox because I can go into C:\Users\Sersoft\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\ and backup/restore all my settings which includes addons, bookmarks, browsing history, cookies and passwords.
